page.title: 13St. Michael's Church, Felton
page.content: The church is a Victorian stone building on a medieval foundation. It was rebuilt in 1852 after a fire and a new stone vicarage was constructed alongside it. The church consists of an aisle, chancel and wooden-spired tower with five bells. The parish of Felton is now amalgamated with Preston Wynne Parish. The vicarage is now a private house. One communion service is held every second Sunday. There is a combined service with other parishes once a year. The church possesses a unique alter frontal and panels designed and embroidered by a Herefordshire artist.
